It arrived at their Warehouse on April 19th (I had tracking on it).  I have not seen it since.  Wasted my money on this horrible product.  I will NEVER purchase another Coby product again!  I have called Customer Service daily every week since - for 5 months!  Every week I get the run around, I have even been dealing with a Manager who is worthless.  I have called Corporate three or four times to complain about the customer service, no one has even called me or emailed me back.  I would BEG Amazon to stop selling this product since their service is so bad.  OOO WELL that's what I get for buying a Cheep Tablet.  I would of been better off purchasing Amazon's Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY FROM ANYTHING BY COBY
Reviews.Author: vanclan
Reviews.Content: Coby 7-Inch Android 4.0 8 GB Internet Tablet 16:9 Capacitive Multi-Touch Widescreen with Built-in Camera, Black MID7065-8Coby Kyros 7-Inch Android 4.0 4 GB Internet Tablet 16:9 Resistive Touchscreen - MID7046-4 (Black)Coby Kyros 7-Inch Android 4.0 4 GB Internet Tablet 16:9 Capacitive Multi-Touch Widescreen with Built-In Camera, Black MID7048-4Coby 7-Inch Android 4.0 8 GB Internet Tablet 16:9 Capacitive Multi-Touch Widescreen with Built-in Camera, Black MID7065-8Coby Kyros 7-Inch Android 4.0 4 GB Internet Tablet 16:9 Resistive Touchscreen - MID7046-4 (Black)Coby Kyros 7-Inch Android 4.0 4 GB Internet Tablet 16:9 Capacitive Multi-Touch Widescreen with Built-In Camera, Black MID7048-4My wife got the tablet from the Army PX for Christmas. It worked ok for about 3 months, then the screen started to freeze up. eventually I had to send it in for repair because it just totally quit.  I sent it in May 9th. they received it a couple days later. There used to be a toll free number to call and get information about the repairs, but they changed it to an automated blurb on the internet.  I cannot contact anybody about this.  It has been over 2 months (11 weeks)and I still don't have it back.  When I accessed the plant where I sent the tablet, the telephone number has been changed with no updates. I guess I just threw away $150.STAY AWAY FROM ANYTHING RELATED TO COBY!!!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY - bad product and lousy customer service
Reviews.Author: Sherry A Crann
Reviews.Content: Bought the MID 7048-4 in Mar.  It worked ok as an epub reader (my main use), a few small apps and light internet activity.  However, almost 3 months out (just inside "warranty" period), the internal drive died (this seems to be too common).  Emails to customer care/tech support went unanswered.  Called, and the guy said send it in with a M/O to cover shipping back a replacement.  I was able to get someone on the phone to track progress a few times (or at least reported progress) til last week, when the phone number suddenly changed from actual people to a recording saying to visit the website for support.  I tried emailing customer care and tech support again, along with filling out the "drop us a line" form (which stinks - only allows a very short message, and no acknowledgement email is sent).  I got an autoresponder that the customercare email address was not found on their server.  I figure I'm out a unit (plus s/h included for the "return" I  have yet to see), and don't want anyone else to experience this garbage either.  I'm now saving up for a Nexus 7.

Reviews.Title: worst customer service and company to return product to
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Coby Kyros 10.1 tablet in December and loved it however 3 months later it quit working completely.  I called customer service and they informed me if I send the tablet back with a $15 money order they would send me a new tablet, that was in April. It is now coming up on August and still waiting.  I have talked to customer service over the phone a few times and they kept pushing the delivery date back and now I can't even get through to the company at all.  I would never recommend this tablet or any other Coby product for that matter.

Reviews.Title: Worked great
Reviews.Author: Earl
Reviews.Content: It was returned due to the "bulkyness" of the product.  It functioned great and I believe that the Android system is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for photographers who want to share pictures
Reviews.Author: Dan In San Diego
Reviews.Content: I'm a photographer who wanted an easy and inexpensive ($99) way to share my images with other photographers and friends.  This tablet fills the bill perfectly.  The screen is very sharp, realistically colorful, and my images look just as good as those on my desktop monitor.If you want a tablet that does everything as well as an iPad does.. buy an iPad.  But if you want an inexpensive, portable, and high-quality photo viewer.. this tablet is for you.

Reviews.Title: No power
Reviews.Author: Frank M. Sabatino
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd one I purchased and all died with the same problem. They will not power on even though they charge for at least 12 hours. The price is right but the quality is very poor. Stay away from Coby.

Reviews.Title: Save  your money
Reviews.Author: robertvijil
Reviews.Content: Surfing the net is a nightmare.  Browser hangs up if you key a couple of  times in a row. Forget customer service. Never have gotten a response. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: good but could be better
Reviews.Author: just_me 507
Reviews.Content: i do not know if it is me but i can not get apps that i downloaded work. i am taking it to a computer shop to find out what i am doing wrong. other that that very pleased with procduct and price. if i get another i will get one with dual cameras so i can take pictures with it

Reviews.Title: It's not the tablet you need to be aware of it is the manufacturer customer service
Reviews.Author: kap2kam
Reviews.Content: I am surprised Amazon partners with a company that does not support it's products.  I bought my Coby Kyros in October 2012.  The screen froze so I sent it in for replacement April 11, 2013.  There are only 2 numbers to call 99% of the time you get a busy signal.  It cost me $30 to send it back. Over $15 to ship it to them and a $15 money order so they could send it back.  They tell it takes 6-8 weeks to get the replacement.  It is now June 13 and I have not been able to get through on the phone for over a month to check the status of it.  The only day of the week I have been able to get through is a Monday and had to sit on hold forever.Honestly I loved my tablet and miss it greatly but I would never by another Coby Kyros because of the lack of customer service.  The product is great while it works, but you might as well kiss it goodbye if you have to send it in for a replacement.If you don't believe me try calling these numbers to see if you get through: 1-800-681-2629  or 1-800-727-3592.Best of luck to those who still wish to buy, but to someone who doesn't have money and time to lose keep shopping.If you do decide to get it; the best free app stores to use with this were Amazon and Mobile1 app store.Get Jar was a joke. Hulu Plus did not work on it but Netflix did.  You do not get 4 GB of space for Apps, App space is very minimal and even with a 16 GB SD card still was pretty limited.  I would by more hard core memory because there are quite a few apps you can't send to the SD card.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Amanda Hunter
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 8 year old son for Christmas last year and it has been a great first tablet!! I myself as an adult was very impressed with it. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is because it does not come equipped with google play store and it is an android tablet, the market it does come with is called GETJAR and it is horrible! Other than that downfall it has stood up to my 8 year old sons beating and he loves it!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet, my pros and cons
Reviews.Author: Peter W.
Reviews.Content: Things to note:- This takes a very small, 5V DC power supply, which is unusual to me.- It is an unsupported Google device = no Play app store, and still can't figure out how to get HBO GO to work on it, and can't get Facebook created app (unless someone tells me where else you can download it from!)- Has a very sensitive power button - last 3 times I've put it in my backpack for use at work, the power button has been hit in transit and I arrive with it drained and unusable. Could probably be remedied by buying a better case than by using the slipcover it comes with.- Back button often exits you out of something, rather than taking you to your last page/position.- Browser, while effective, does not have near the same functionality as the browser on my PC.- Browser feels slow to me, and it's annoying.Other things to note:- Sound quality was surprisingly good for what it is.- Keyboard is awesome and works really well, which surprised me.- Absolutely zero lag in streaming of either music or video - win!!!- You can still do lots of great stuff, like use other social media apps that allow you to view Facebook, or use the browser for it (can't get browser version of HBO GO however, *sad clown face*).- Use Amazon app store for lots of good stuff even if you can't use Google Play app store - the Get Jar app store was surprisingly limited. Might just be the brand new O/S.- Picks up home wi-fi & mobile hotspot (wi-fi from my phone) just great, never had a problem with that!- Renders books really well and is fun to use for reading.I ordered it here at Amazon, price is just amazing: http://amzn.to/17Hj0ZN

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet Bad Service
Reviews.Author: Eric Weisbrodt
Reviews.Content: My Coby Kryos was a good tablet until it broke. The charger pin fell out. The tablet was still under warranty, so I contacted Coby and sent it back. Two months later, I still don't have my tablet and I can't get a reasonable answer as to when it will be fixed or replaced. I won't ever buy from Coby again.

Reviews.Title: Coby 7 MID 7048
Reviews.Author: Keariyon
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great. The first thing people not might like about this tablet is that it does not have google play but 1Mobile Market is exactly like Google Play Store. It has all the apps like Facebook,Fun Run,Angry Birds and more. And most of all I love skype on this. The picture is not the clearist but you see them very good and most of all they see you too but its best you have a good connection for it to work. And in the reviews they say the battery life is bad which it weird because to me the battery life is good. I love the Ice Cream Sandwhich UI ( User Interface )and the speed is qutie impressive. The only reason it's 4 instead of 5 is because sometimes about 1 every 2 days the tablet will freeze. When this happens you have to wait until the battery dies and connect it to the charger and turn it on but thats just atlittle bug it doesnt happen every day. I did buy this Used in Very Good Condition which makes it only 45$ and for the price I might say this tablet is worth the money.BUT GUESS WHAT THERE IS A WAY TO GET GOOGLE PLAY IT REALLY WORKS!!!!!!!!! GO TO THIS LINK AND FOLLOW THE DIREECTIONS IT REALLY WORKS I SWEAR I PUT IT ON MY MOTHERS SOUL!!!!! CLICK THE LINK BELOWhttp://androidalittleofeverything.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Victoria Daines
Reviews.Content: Its just nice to have something more easier to handle with out having to use the keyboard with the mouse.Love the touch screenThanks,Victoria

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Ruth Portillo
Reviews.Content: the sound is not very good, I love the screen it works pretty well, but I've had connection problems when the  wifi signal is not near enough, but other tablets around  have not that problem, the camera for video calls works excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Value - price vs features
Reviews.Author: Patrick W. Corkill
Reviews.Content: While there may be better tablets available, for the money this one seems to be the best bang for the buck. It does everything I wanted or needed, although the SW store you go to get new free applications is not as robust as it could be.

Reviews.Title: very good product
Reviews.Author: Fernando Núñez Tarazona
Reviews.Content: is very fast, I like a lot and is very comfortable to carry by its size, I like the color and design.

Reviews.Title: Keep freezing
Reviews.Author: DNache W.
Reviews.Content: I don't what the issue with this tablet was but it would keep freezing. The Coby support team was great and did everything they could to help me over the phone but I had to return the product due to the issues.

Reviews.Title: Probably one of the largest tablets for the money.
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Pros: Large screen, ok processor, large memory expansion capability, USB port, and pretty good quality material and screenCons: Somewhat laggy likely due to ice cream sandwich, the SD card expansion cannot be used to install programs (there are apps that supposedly allow you to do this but they have yet to work and yes I rooted the tablet successfully). The backlighting on the screen seams cheap since you can't see the picture at certain angles, the front facing camera is of poor quality and sucks if you dont' have bright lighting on you.

Reviews.Title: Good Basic Tablet.
Reviews.Author: Ed Groves
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd tablet we have purchased. They do a fine job for the price. Are they as good as an Ipad you ask??  Well compare the price! The Ipad has more apps available, and more features, but they are hundreds of dollars more!If you want to do some basic surfing, gaming, reading, playing videos and MP3s, you can't go wrong with this tablet.  Great 1st computer for teens. My wife even purchased one and she loves it!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: miguel a contreras j
Reviews.Content: it suppplies all my needs according the product and the benefits whos offering i am satisfied with it at all

Reviews.Title: good lightweight tablet once 1mobile installed
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Lightweight fast & affordable!  Initially I waa disappointed because it doesn't come with Google Play & Get Jar is a joke if you want relavent Apps. But since I found 1Mobile it has been a fantastic tablet for the price. I would recommend it highly to anyone looking for cheap tablet. I would give 5 stars except for the get Jar annoyance.

Reviews.Title: Look before you buy
Reviews.Author: Carol Anne Huff
Reviews.Content: I've had it  for a little more than a week now, and am already thinking of replacing it. First, I had trouble getting the sd card in,and the cover to the sd card is a little rubber tab that tries to rip the first time you open it, and then it doesn't stay closed.  It's a good price and I thought it would be good for us beginners. I do need something to to help me read since I have glaucoma and my sight is starting to fail me.  But I also enjoy games and music. However, it seems more often than not the gaming apps can't be supported by the Kyros.  Pick out some apps from right here at the app store and you'll see.  Also, you cannot put cloud on it either.  Now I swear by Amazon, and preferCoby Kyros 8-Inch Android 4.0 4 GB Internet Tablet 4:3 Capacitive Multi-Touchscreen with Built-In Camera, Black MID8048-4 to only shop here. But with the Coby Kyros that's just not possible.  So if none of these things are important to you than go ahead, like I said, it's a very good price. Just think about it first. Or like me, you may end up paying for two tablets in the end.

Reviews.Title: Worst POS ever
Reviews.Author: Brian Lorenc
Reviews.Content: Yep I got this thing as my first introduction to tablet computing and it basically sucks. My iPhone is like 1000% FASTER. It is sooo dang slow it's like trying to load the internet on a 486 computer from 1995, over dial up. I'm thinking of lighting it on fire but I don't think that's environmentally responsible to I will probably sell it on ebay for like $1 plus shipping. The only thing this could possibly be good for is maybe book reading from Amazaon. Oh did I mention you can't use the google app down loader? Only the the Amazon one will work and it takes a little effort to get that installed even. If there was a 1/2 star I would pick that this thing is so bad. $109 down the drain and lesson learned I guess. Save up and buy the cheapest iPad don't make the same mistake I made.

Reviews.Title: It's fine
Reviews.Author: John W. Martin
Reviews.Content: It's pretty much what I expected BUT the touch screen is not very sensative.  Sometimes I have to sit there and tap on it about 5 to 10 times in the same spot before it recognizes that Im even trying to do something.

Reviews.Title: NOT BAD FOR MY FIRST TABLET....OOPS!
Reviews.Author: OLDWISE1
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my Coby.  Never had a tablet before...they are a little user unfriendly but I am getting the hang of it.  I did buy a case/stand and keyboard but I am unable to connect keyboard to my tablet as the USB connector does not fit.  I thought they were all standard but I guess not.  I am not sure what to do now except do they make converters from the large USB connector on the keyboard down to a smaller connection on the tablet????  Otherwise I am happy.UPDATE 5/19/13:  Had this tablet a little over a month and....it is gone!  Went dead, no response at all.  I am out a tablet!

Reviews.Title: Cheap but good, sometimes can't connect USB keyboard
Reviews.Author: Luis R.
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of them, they aren't full feature tablets but for basic it's good, their G-sensor is not so good, screen is tricky (it took me a while to adapt to it 'cause it's no 100% accurate and I didn't find how to calibrate), don't have bluetooth but WI-FI is good. Works for Skype. I bought two keyboard USB cases and I had to buy a couple of OTG cables (tablets have micro-USB port and even doing that, one didn't make them work. It doesn't include Play Market by default but it can  be solved by googling a bit or installing other. One last thing, if used for too much time for watching videos, gaming or something that demands high performance, it'll get really hot so I'd not recommend to leave it on your bed to avoid overheating

Reviews.Title: Terrible Experience
Reviews.Author: Clarebear
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my mother as a Christmas gift. She used it for a total of 2-3 days, and then the device completely shut off. I kept the receipt and returned it to Coby warranty. It took several weeks for Coby to get back to me. They told me that I would have to send a $15 money order so the company could replace the device with a new tablet.I would never recommend this company to anyone. The tablet is also very unimpressive - the screen and icons are dull and it isn't easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great price
Reviews.Author: sasha
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband and he loves it. And for the price it's great. It does all the necessary.

Reviews.Title: A Pleasure To Use
Reviews.Author: Revlchurch
Reviews.Content: Even though the tablet ( Coby Kyros 7-inch Mid7048-4 ) is not the fastest or has the brightest screen, I have found that so far it is performing beyond expectations considering the price.  I had purchased the same model just a week before but when it arrived it was defective so I returned it and ordered this one although the price was significantly more.  But when it arrived and I began setting it up for my wife to use I found it was more responsive than either her Nook Color or the Kindle Fire for the apps that she will be using.  The android 4.0 makes it easy to customize the display and although it doesn't come with the Google Apps store it is possible with a bit of know how to get a version that will work on this little machine.  It's advantages as far as my wife is concerned are the Small form factor, the light weight, and the thinness of the unit making it easy to slip into her purse, a coat pocket or a bookbag.  I would suggest looking for a 7-inch form factor enclosure like a Gator, Duraclose, or any number of other suppliers just to had a bit more durability to the e-reader.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good buy!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Valliant
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a tablet that I could use for reading books and occasionally watching Netflix. I did my homework and was a bit leary of this product and it's reviews but figured I'd give it a try. I was pleased with what I recieved. It handles nicely and I would compare it to a bigger version of an itouch. You do have to be tech savvy enough to either download Amazon appstore (very easy) or Android appstore (takes a bit more work) but after that it's an awesome tablet for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not a good fit
Reviews.Author: Crazy Buyer "crazy buyer"
Reviews.Content: was excited to get this item, but could not get it to sync to my wifi or any wifi for that matter

Reviews.Title: love it so much
Reviews.Author: findjy dorvil
Reviews.Content: I love it work just like I  thought its I love everything about it .... its really great after long day of work or school

Reviews.Title: ok tablet
Reviews.Author: Bernard Williams
Reviews.Content: its a very affordable tablet but becuase it does now have google play it is very lacking in apps and with that it feels like a old version battery life is pretty bad to if watching videos u will need to charge afterwards if u not a fan of apps and just need a quick device for web browseing i recomend this if u like watching videos and apps i dont recommend this

Reviews.Title: Cheri Neema
Reviews.Author: Cheri Neema
Reviews.Content: Hi I'm a little dissapointed with the slow Ness. It's also not a device that downloads Android apps and I didn't receive the accident protection I ordered. Please Weres the accident protection plan?

Reviews.Title: wonderful , love it
Reviews.Author: sandra
Reviews.Content: Great device , no problems with it , Just what I wanted. It does everything I needed it to do . Would recommend it to anyone who is looking to buy a tablet .

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Emmy
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a starter tablet for our granddaughter. She loves it. I am ordering another one for our grandson for bis birthday.

Reviews.Title: GOOD PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: NICHOLAS FRISON
Reviews.Content: GREAP PRODUCT, MORE VALUES AND DEALS LIKE ITI, I WOULD RECOMMEND FOR YOUNGER KIDS AND PRE TEEN ADOLESCENTS. YES YES

Reviews.Title: My first tablet
Reviews.Author: Dennis Bowe
Reviews.Content: It is everything I expected.  Easy to use, the Get-Jar has tons of apps. The battery last four hours just like it said.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Wright
Reviews.Content: My husband thanks me for this tablet everyday. He has to get on it at least once a day. The apps are great.

Reviews.Title: gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Gloria Williams
Reviews.Content: im limited in the apps i can download. i also bought with generic keyboard that is awesome but you MUST MUST MUST  buy the female to malemini usb piece seperately. save yourself aggravation and get it off amazon aswell. impossible to find at retailers. im not the most computer savvy so this allows mw to get most of what i need done. the screen can be slightly lumpier than other tablets. but i absolutely love the size and comfort. also stay close to an outlet, runs outta juice fast.

Reviews.Title: A few good qualities but overall a disappointment.
Reviews.Author: Kruesser
Reviews.Content: My wife is letting me order an Android tablet for my birthday so I was aiming for a $150 spending limit. I found this tablet and thought that it would be a nearly perfect fit. The specs looked good, a 10.1 inch display, I was won over. However when showing the link to my dad after I ordered it he pointed out the it does NOT have the Android Play Store on it. I thought no big deal. It's an Android tablet, how hard is it to get the play store downloaded? Biggest pain in the rear end ever... I picked up the package from the post office and gave up after a few hours. As far as I know there is no way to get the play store on there unless you root/jailbreak it; but even then the chances of it working are extremely slim. I tried out the GetJar store that comes with in instead of the PlayStore. WASTE OF TIME. They have the worst selection you could possibly find. Even a shoe store has a better selection of canned goods than GetJar has apps. My phone, which is outdated if not soon, can surf the internet faster than this tablet could. The only redeeming feature it had was the 10.1 inch screen. So unless your going to use it only for email/internet with little to no app downloading then dont bother. I had it for a few hours and then I put in right back in the box and shipped it away to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: Coby tablet
Reviews.Author: serita sue hafely:
Reviews.Content: I like it very much, but I wish I could download google play and itunes a lot of apps I want and I can not get.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: avto_key
Reviews.Content: Hi costumers, Coby MID1042-8 is very powerful tablet, battery is very hardly, it's alive time is about 8-10 hr. touch screen is very sensitive, CPU looks like normal and Video card is cool.I want to say some problems that this tablet has, The first is problem about relationship between USB Flash Drive and Coby, Second problem is on-screen home button do not perfectly work (when I install adobe flash and some apps, after that home button do nothing )If I found some other problems or some other remarkable things, I'll write hare.Best wishes,Avtandil Kavrelishvili

Reviews.Title: SECOND TIME BUYING!
Reviews.Author: T.A.A
Reviews.Content: This is my second time buying. This tablet is really great for web browsing and a little video browsing and a few pictures here and there. 10 inch version was amazing, this 7 inch one had a little issue. I'll list the cons and pros below.CONS--Screen lighting, screen is way to dark even when put on the full setting- Camera is flipped upside down. There is no way fixing that, that is how it was manufactured, I'm not sure if it was just mine or everybody's but it is upside down.- NO ANDROID STORE, ONLY GETJAR APP PLACE.-PlasticPROS-- Light weight-Cheap- Easy to carry- Easy to cleanFor the price this product is just find. But if you have the money, don't waste it buying this, save up a few more hundred and get a much better one.

Reviews.Title: Very Basic
Reviews.Author: D. S. Clark "scottfoto"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to show clients a product I provide through Google Street View. This would not properly display Google Streetview and really wouldn't install any Google Apps. I rooted the device and was able to install through Google Play, but still they did not act right. I sold product for a loss since Amazon doesn't allow returns of this device.

Reviews.Title: Slow!
Reviews.Author: Ann M. Rose
Reviews.Content: I tried this on a trip, I hated it.  Wifi pickup was sketchy at best, and very slow.  I sent it back and bought an Ipad.

Reviews.Title: Coby Kyros tablet
Reviews.Author: timW
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for a year. I purchased a tablet for my wife, but returned it. I purchased the same Cosby Kyros 7 inch tablet for my wife and she loves it. She, and I, enjoy the Kindle app I installed on it. The tablet is awesome..and highly recommend for anyone that doesn't want to purchase a more expensive one.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!!
Reviews.Author: Janine
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews in late December, I was almost afraid to purchase this 8" coby tablet.Then I read further reviews that I can confirm what they had said , and yes there IS Adobe Flash installed when I received it, it is well made and designed, glass panel, HDMI output, computer to tablet cable included to move apps to the tablet or sd card and more.I paid $115 it is now $109. That is a steal!! This is a touchscreen 8" diag tablet that instantly connected to my wifi router, Had good apps installed on it and if you just google apps w/the .apk at end you will find many sites that carry the same apps as googleplay (which does not work if unrooted). So, many many aps out there. Total internet surfing. Great game playing.Yes the battery life is about 2 hours, but you can plug in and still use, plus it charges pretty quick.If this goes below $100 w free shipping I may get another as backup.Just do your homework and the solutions to most problems are there!Nice.Now, I hope I didn't jinx my tablet.I will update when trying out the 1080p video on my tv.Buy it, its inexpensive and works.  Dollar Tree sellls the stylus for , well, a buck.

Reviews.Title: A quick tip if your MID1042-8 sucks.
Reviews.Author: P. Cappiello "Gibson Fan"
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas present. I wanted an inexpensive tablet to see if it would compare or replace my smartphone or laptop. I found the instructions somewhat confusing and it was hard to set up things like on my other devices. Within a few days it had slowed to a crawl and even simple things like ebay or Amazon took forever. I was ready to either throw this against the wall or put it on ebay.But then.......I went into the setup menu and cleared the cache and cookies in the privacy&security; settings.I also deleted my saved apps.  Then I pushed in the reset button and rebooted it. Voila !!! like magic I had a tablet. Apps ran at good speeds and I was pretty happy. My brother brought over his Ipad mini and I compared the two. The ipad was way faster and felt better, but it also costs more than twice as much. So before you pitch yours , try resetting it.

Reviews.Title: This is a great cheap tablet!
Reviews.Author: Michelle R. Egan
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for about a week now, and I have no idea what all the bad reviews are about. It's perfect for getting on the internet, facebook, playing games, reading, and probably more things that I haven't figured out yet. I got this tablet to get on the internet at school between classes. It isn't as good as a laptop, but for about $115 I wouldn't expect it to be. The only problems I've had so far are (ironically) with the amazon appstore and the tablet has frozen up twice. The amazon appstore gets stuck, and you have to clear the data out and log back into your amazon account. The tablet has only frozen up when I was charging the device while using it. Lesson learned; don't do that. It charges nicely while off or in sleep mode; in fact, it seems to charge faster while in sleep mode. The battery does run down quickly with constant use but I can use it for about 3 hours a day and only have to charge it up at night. Don't freak because GetJar sucks and it doesn't have GooglePlay; get the amazon appstore and 1mobilemarket and you're set. You might want to download Avast for mobile devices; it scans downloading apps to make sure they're not malware and it's free! The 8 inch size is perfect for students; the tablet fits neatly into a backpack and is small enough to use even on those tiny desks some classrooms have.

Reviews.Title: coby kyros
Reviews.Author: mistydavis29
Reviews.Content: Its ok for a starter tablet....but not worth the money! I expected more for the amount...will do more research next time.

Reviews.Title: good product, great value
Reviews.Author: ra
Reviews.Content: Honestly, because of the price, I was expecting less, but I was pleasantly surprised. I am an IT pro, and was able get it on exchange, my VPN, surf the internet, etc etc. I am pleased with the response/speed, hasnt crashed on me yet. Two things, however: you can not get on google play, and getjar is very limited. The alternative: 1mobile. that has lots of good apps. I found a good amount of free ebooks, as well. Can watch full movies on crackle, and even live TV with certain apps. Overall I am very happy with the product, but like anything else, someone can hand you a ferrari and if you cant drive youll wreck it then say the car sucks.

Reviews.Title: Good For Price, Bad Support. Tiny reset button easily missed.
Reviews.Author: Justaconsumer
Reviews.Content: I give it 3 stars because it seems to work great for the price. I replaced my Kindle Fire for this just to get Flash and other Android Apps. It loses a star because it doesn't access the Google Play store, but I found most of the free apps I was looking for on the Good E-Reader App store and some good paid apps on the Amazon Apps store.It loses another star because the tech support is lousy. After a week of using the tablet, it shut itself down (despite having a full charge) and wouldn't power up or reset when I followed the manual trouble shooting instructions. I replaced it with Amazon's return policy, and had the same symptoms a week after getting a replacement. Ready to give up, I called the customer support from the manufacturer, and they didn't have a clue. What neither the phone customer support rep nor the manual mentioned is that there's a tiny paperclip reset button on the side next to the HDMI port. It fixed my power problem. It was mentioned on their website, but it should have been in the manual and the phone support rep should have known about it. I shouldn't have had to keep digging for that answer.The Amazon App store is buggy on it. The Apps purchased from the store seem to periodically uninstall themselves randomly, causing you to have to re-download them. Every time I exited it or shut down the tablet, the App interphase disappears. I had to clear the data and re-register just to get it working again.  And then I had to manually delete the old registrations from my Amazon account online. One good thing about the bug, the purchased apps work despite the disappearing app store interphase problem, which was fine with me because there is no way to sign out of the app store or restrict my kids from purchasing apps once I've registered. I found that an older version of the Amazon app store worked on the tablet, but still didn't have a feature allowing users to sign out, so I re-installed the version with the disappearing app store interphase bug, just to keep my kids from purchasing apps. Amazon needs to fix both the disappearing interphase problem and include a feature to either sign out or restrict the purchasing of apps. The way the store works now, it only restricts existing in-app purchasing, but not the purchasing of new apps.

Reviews.Title: Purchased the COBY 7048
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Rollins "cfpmdrt"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a tablet for about 6 months before I purchased this one.  I must have read every review on Amazon about it.  Some reviews were good and some were just bad.  I was all set to purchase the Google Nexus 10, but the production problems, and even with the Nexus 7, kept me from buying one of those now.  I will buy one or the other in the next version.  I bought the COBY 7048 for about $92.  As cheap as they were listed on Amazon or Ebay.  It is what it is, an inexpensive tablet.  I have found that I can use the basic apps for email, documents to go, facebook, browse the internet without probles.  The WIFI isn't an issue for me in my house.  The size is what you would one handed.  It isn't heavy as I read in bed or watch a video on HBO.go or Netflix.  My only complaint is the battery life.  I get about 2.5 hours on a long overnight charge with heavy web browsing usage.  I would honestly rate this an OK tablet. If what you want is a basic tablet with a more than just a reader, then get this one for the right price.  I also bought the COBY tablet case.  It is very well made and was cheaply priced on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Bummer
Reviews.Author: milton williams
Reviews.Content: Totally disappointed. Camera sucks, apps hard to load, mini usb quit working on third day after slight knock. Most of flash memory used up by os, will not write to my sd card. Internet connection spotty. I would not recommend this to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: Nice performance and great value
Reviews.Author: Jorge Rapalo Schmahlfeldt
Reviews.Content: Got this to replace a Kyros 1125 whose touchscreen was ruined by absentmindedly leaving it for a month in an airtight sleeve right by an open window during summer.  The 1125 had been my workhorse tablet and this looks to be a good replacement. I appreciate the full-sized usb slot added, and having the latest version of the Android OS is great.The frame of the 1125 seemed a bit more durable as the 1042 has a more plastic-like finish in its construction, but that appears to makes it lighter and that is useful for a 10-inch tablet.  The loss of the 1125's various fixed button controls on the face-frame is no big deal as I often pressed them by accident when changing grips while reading.Resolution is not the greatest, but it works very well as a comic reader.  Perfect Viewer was quite fast in both display and taking in a large collection of comics, so the machine does not feel underpowered at all.Aldiko and other useful apps come pre-installed.  No significant bloat.As warning to prospective buyers, while Coby tablets lack the official Google apps and marketplace, the 1125 Kyros could easily have these added by just installing a few files, without need for rooting or any tinkering with the OS.  The 1042 however cannot install Google Play, the Gmail app, etc with similar ease.  I tested instead the GetJar app marketplace offered and found it quite lacking.  Several favorite apps that I had read GetJar carried could however not be found.  Sure, you can get Angry Birds, but no Perfect Viewer, no Cool Reader.  But the Amazon marketplace installed without problem, and so did the SlideMe and GoodeReader markets, so I could get all the free apps I sought.Navigation of the file system is a bit clumsy.  Unlike in my Coby Kyros 7 incher, the file manager did not show me in easy to access fashion the contents of my slotted 16GB SD card.  I had to go and look for it in the "mnt" folder.  Once the apps had the path saved it proved no problem anymore, but I wonder if my having just moved over the card from my older 1125 without cleaning its contents cause that.  Anyway, you have to go up the folders path but you can access the card, just know that it will shown as "extsd" in "mnt".More comments to follow as I work more with it.

Reviews.Title: Coby Kyros tablets
Reviews.Author: charlesbanks
Reviews.Content: The Coby Kyros 10inch tablets were purchased for gifts to grandchildren. they found them easy to set up and was playing within an hour.good so far.

Reviews.Title: no bluetooth for link to keyboard but neat little device
Reviews.Author: bloodhoundgrl
Reviews.Content: linked up to wifi fast, fun little thing to play with for the $$ but don't expect to hook it to a keyboard, your phone, ipod or anything because there's no bluetooth. My fault for not reading the specs better. But return was easy.

Reviews.Title: Regular
Reviews.Author: Armilso From  Colombia
Reviews.Content: is missing the rear camera and 3G slot, for others lol is a good option, emusic store for coby, only available in USA

Reviews.Title: Coby Kyros Android Tablet
Reviews.Author: heidi
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my mom for Christmas on Cyber Monday. I got a really great deal for what I thought I was getting. When my mom opened the tablet on Christmas, my brother (a major techie) started playing with it and showing my mom how to use it. He soon realized that the "Android" Coby was using for this tablet wasn't the Android that most people are used to. Android is open source and anyone can take it and make changes to it. That's what Coby did. They don't use the Play Store (like the majority of Android powered devices) and we still haven't found a way to download it. My brother told my mom and I that he can root the tablet and change it to the Android that we know and love, but that takes time and skill. Other than the Android problem, we like the tablet. It has clear graphics and an ok camera, although it doesn't have a back-facing camera, only a front facing. I would recommend this tablet for anyone that doesn't care whether or not they are getting a legitimate Android operating system or can take the time to root it.

Reviews.Title: At least it looked pretty
Reviews.Author: Ashlie B.
Reviews.Content: I got the Coby Kyros tablet as a present for a family member. When they first opened it up everything appeared to be working. The screen looked fine and the screen response was perfect, but then when we tried to connect it to WiFi the problems started. We would connect it to the appropriate signal but then immediately after that the the tablet would say "not in range". So, we tried again only this time she sat right next to the wireless router and it said the exact same thing. The only good thing was that Amazon has an easy and painless return policy for gifts.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: nancywilliams
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my husband who is 85yrs. of age.  He mainly uses it for reading books, music any games.  Great itm for the money.

Reviews.Title: Nice cheap tablet
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Not amazing, but you get a good deal for the price.  The only thing is the OS is not native android.

Reviews.Title: Price
Reviews.Author: Hankstar "Hank"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this with the intent of using mainly as an e-book reader. I  was going to buy a KINDLE, but I thought they could only be used to read KINDLE books. After I started using the KYROS I was impressed with the things it could do. Browser, e-mail, lot of PC stuff. The KYROS does most of what an IPAD can do- maybe not as quickly or as well, but adequately. All in all, I am very satisfied with the kyros especially for $149.95.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Becky Goins
Reviews.Content: Love my new tablet! Got one for my mother-in-law for Christmas and she loves hers too! Shipped very fast. Happy

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet
Reviews.Author: april green
Reviews.Content: My son enjoys his tablet and its many functions. Good product for the price that I paid for it. I would probably buy a kindle fire he next time.

Reviews.Title: good tablet for its price
Reviews.Author: lloyola
Reviews.Content: I needed a tablet to chek mail, watch videos in youtube, read newspaper on line, get apps from 1mobile such as twitter,facebook, tuneinradio, kindle reader, angry birds,  everything works ok, processor is fast enough and capacitive screen works fine.Cons. when you let battery run off you have to reset the tablet, i wish for a better battery and a better screen resolution , but for a starter tablet is good.

Reviews.Title: My Daughter Loves It!
Reviews.Author: Karla Hall
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 9 year old for Christmas.  Had some trouble with getting Getjar to work.  I do not like how the app works.  I downloaded the Amazon App store for android and it is so much better.  The tablet is easy to use.  For the price would recommend the product.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the $
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: Good inexpensive tablet for the first time user. We bypassed GetJar and downloaded Amazon App Store. It's a little slow and notice it likes to cut out of wifi occasionally, don't know if it's this unit or our connection... All in all a good tablet for occasional basic use.

Reviews.Title: Liked it.
Reviews.Author: Cecil PeÃ±a
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 11 years old son, he is very pleased..he use it mostly to play and navegate internet..so its been perfect for him.

Reviews.Title: Donnieb2334582002
Reviews.Author: Donnieb233458
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this product. On Christmas 2012 my two children opened these gifts and I spent most of the day trying to get them to work. My brother who is a computer tech also worked on them and found them difficult to work. The problem is Getgar is terrible, you cannot download Google Play, You Tube stops and the unit crashes. Also the recommended keyboard that pops up when you order is not compatible. Both tablets and keyboards are being returned as we speak. If I have any issues with the return, I will post another review. Otherwise assume Amazon processed the return for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Muy buena
Reviews.Author: Arturo Montero Contreras
Reviews.Content: Es demasiado buena y sencilla de usar muy util para lo que la queria. Lleno todas mis expectativas. Vale la pena.

Reviews.Title: Coby Kyros 8-inch
Reviews.Author: Luis Castillo Salazar
Reviews.Content: Good purchase with little money!!!The tablet has a good quality and it serves if you want to have more than a basic perfomance and you don't have enough money...

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Kim Welborn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my daughter and she is so very happy with it.  It is very fast and the 8 inch screen is very clear and easy to see.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great price.
Reviews.Author: lamar
Reviews.Content: I bought the tablet for my wife. She loves it! It has a lot of great features and is very easy to use right out of the box. My wife is very happy and I am happy with how quick and easy it was to order from the seller and amazon. I would recommend going with the 10.1 size bigger is always better. It does come with getjar and not google play, which was the only down side. We were able to get cool apps from amazon. Great product for the price.Buy this tablet you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet for the middle of the road user
Reviews.Author: Bryan McAvoy
Reviews.Content: Tablet worked fine right out of the box, my only improvement area is the internet speed, it runs a little slower then my laptops!enjoyed having it while shopping, we could show stores we were at lower prices in other stores and they would price match, that saved us close to 100 dollars over the Christmas holiday. Wife kept in her pocketbook easy enough,Great reader, I am not a big reader but i enjoy reading on this,

Reviews.Title: Great Choice
Reviews.Author: danni k
Reviews.Content: This product works great.  We fired it up right out of the box and were easily able to connect wifi, download apps and its working great.  I would recommend going to amazon app and downloading that to get your apps from, as getjar didn't work so well.  All in all a great product!  We have purchased 3 now, one for Grandma and 2 for daughters (8 and 7 yrs)  very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Decent for the price
Reviews.Author: Synieth
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet for my dad for Christmas.  For less than $100 its an excellent little tablet, especially for my dad who won't do anything with it but check email, facebook, and his favorite car forums.I'd have given it five stars but for the issue with connecting to the wifi. I spent all Christmas day trying to get it to connect to the wifi with no luck. I browsed tons of similar questions on android forums and finally got it to say it is connected, with "excellent" connection, but webpages still don't work.  It's definitely not our internet connection because all the laptops, computers and cell-phones in the house connect without any trouble.  I was finally able to get him onto the internet with my mom's verizon wireless hotspot, but as of today still no luck connecting to the wifi.  I'm waiting to see if he wants to try to return it for a new one.

Reviews.Title: My 14 year old favorite Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: T. Jordan "Addicted to Amazon"
Reviews.Content: I refuse to pay Ipad, and  Samsung Galaxy prices for a 14 year old knowing something else will be  out soon.  It came withit's fast enough for her.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Gabojpb
Reviews.Content: The coby kyros its a great and affordable tablet. It's fast, reliable and easy to use. The bad thing is that it didn't come with google play and the battery runs dry fast.

Reviews.Title: Excelente Servicio
Reviews.Author: YEILIN
Reviews.Content: Perfecta para lo que lo quería, excelente atención, desde venezuela, se conecta a internet en perfectas condiciones y muy facil de manejar

Reviews.Title: product
Reviews.Author: Patricia G
Reviews.Content: I had to order 2 as last minute replacement gifts...not happy with the the GetJar App...over all not a bad tablet, but the lack of Google apps is a big downfall.

Reviews.Title: so so...still discovering
Reviews.Author: ana trigueros
Reviews.Content: It looks like a great table for the price, but I did not know that you can not use Google Play even is it is an android. I was very frustrated trying to set it up for my son and discovering that GetJar program for app that comes with it , it's not what I was looking for. Reviews.Title: Good value for price
Reviews.Author: m conde
Reviews.Content: The touch screen is a little quirky, but it seems like a good value for a basic tablet.There is a way to activate Google Play on the tablet without being a computer expert.You can do it in about 10 min.  Instructions:1) on your computer download root_gapps_signed.zip from the following website: [...]2) on tablet go to settings > developer options and allow "USB debugging" by checking the box3) connect tablet to computer with USB cable and allow device to be used as external device4) place the root app "root_gapps_signed.zip" in the tablet (I placed in the internal memory)5) rename "root_gapps_signed.zip" to "update.zip"6) Go to Settings > About tablet > System updates > Install system update > From internal storage > Install now7) When I ran the updater, it gave me an error message indicating it could not find the file, if this happens, scroll down and select to run again8) after the update is complete, reboot9) using your tablet's web browser, go to google play (set up the account if necessary) and download your apps.Worked for me and it greatly increases the tablet's usability...

Reviews.Title: Solid entry level tablet for kids.
Reviews.Author: John from Jersey "network ninja"
Reviews.Content: Let's get this out of the way: average tablet, average score. It's not a Nexus 7 or a Kindle Fire.That said, it's got pretty solid but plastic-y build quality, and the screen is remarkably responsive. The GetJar app store is passable, and the Amazon App Store is worth far more, but what counts is whether you can get the Android Play Store on it, and I'm happy to report that you can.It's a little involved, and I wouldn't recommend it for people that are scared of command line windows, but with a small amount of effort you can have a great little Android 4.0 tablet with full Play Store access. There's an entire thread on it at AndroidTablets.net and the step by step instructions have been posted: [...]You can play Minecraft PE and it works perfectly. No problems with video playback and I can give the kids more storage space by popping in an SD card. I haven't tried Netflix yet, but that should work. I think we'll be plenty good for a preschooler and a kindergartener...older kids would be better suited with a more full-featured tablet.

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service from Coby
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet in December 2012 as a gift for my daughter. Two months after receiving it, the part where you plug it in to charge just caved in. I called Coby and they said I could send it to get repaired for free, just send a $15 money order so they could ship it back. I followed their instructions, and sent the tablet in March. It's now October, and I still haven't gotten my tablet back. I've called several times but every time I call I get a different story. It's always some lame excuse, followed by "Your tablet will get back to you within a few weeks". 5 times now that "few weeks" has passed without my tablet coming back. If you are thinking about buying this, just take a look at Coby Electronics facebook page. [...] It's so bad they had to make it so people couldn't comment on their page. But read the comments posted on ANY of their posts. My problem with the company is not just a fluke....Don't buy this. You are better off spending a little more on something from a more reputable company. I lost out on the $100 I payed for it, the $15 I spent shipping it back to them, and the $15 I sent with it so they could ship it back.

Reviews.Title: Coby Kyros
Reviews.Author: Attezor
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this tablet. For me, it was to slow. Trying to use apps like facebook or the internet browser was frustrating. Typing was even worse. I wouldn't recommend this tablet for a adult or teenager at all. Unless they don't want to browse the net or play around on facebook.I used this as an eReader for many months. It's perfect for such a simple task. Until the charge port broke off as I tried to charge it. It can be charged via USB but that takes three times as long.Eventually I upgraded to a faster tablet and gave this one to my three year old. I loaded toddler apps on it, as well as movies and cartoons for him. It's able to keep up with the toddler apps very well. Movie graphics are unbelievable. How can a tablet that plays movies this well, have a laggy keyboard?!This tablet survived many falls, being stepped on, wet and sticky hands and being thrown. However, it finally broke when dropped from a shopping cart.I would recommend this as a child's tablet. Yes ours broke, but it lasted over a year through two toddlers. No case protection. I originally bought the Nabi 2 and the ematic funtab for my children, the screens broke on those " child safe " tablets in under a week - in cases with supervision. The nabi was smacked to hard playing the drum app, and the Ematic was dropped, one foot from the ground onto plush carpet. They were the same price (at the time) and half the size, and didn't have the freedom this tablet does.Bottom line, its cheap, you can download a ton of free & cheap apps on this tablet and it will most defiantly  take abuse. I have ordered the newer version to replace this one. ( Also getting a case for this one lol)

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this,used, as an interim replacement until I could afford a better one. My primary interest was in reading and in my college work. It has worked very well, and will get passed down to others when I no longer need it. Pros: It surprisingly does not lock up all that much. It is lightweight and easy to handle. Cons: The battery life is not what I had hoped for, but did improve a bit with use. It does not carry Google play store, but I knew that going in. I was unable to download my Kobo app, but Kindle and Nook were downloaded with no problem.This is a perfect starter tablet for a youngster just learning how to read and who needs to learn how to care for expensive electronics cheaply. It is also perfect for older readers who may not be interested in everything the more expensive tablets can offer. Although I am technically an older reader at 62, I have been using computers since I was in the Air Force, and am an electronics junkie. Also, I am a junior in college, and I use it for my college textbooks.

Reviews.Title: DON'T DO IT
Reviews.Author: K. K. T. Coyle
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet on sale through Verizon, I had it for a week, tried to plug it in via USB to my computer, it turned off and would not turn back on.  Verizon ordered a new one for me because it was under 14 days (Thanks for the good customer service Verizon).  I got the new one and immediately locked myself out (don't change your pass code late at night before you go to sleep).  I spent a week trying different combinations, found it, went to plug it in so it would not die as I was changing the pass code back to something I could remember, and it went dark again. Verizon couldn't take it back again, now I get to mail it to Coby at my expense with $15 and I suspect I will not be getting a refund.  I don't really want a replacement at this time, there must be a design weakness near the power/usb outlet. I can't get one to work for more than 3 days.  I will update when I find out for sure.  If you absolutely must try this out, get it from amazon, then it can be returned easily.

Reviews.Title: Good unit for the cost!
Reviews.Author: M. Hershberger
Reviews.Content: I previously had a 7" with only 2.3 OS until it was broken recently.  Found this larger tablet which is an improvement for screen size, not to mention having the latest 4.0 OS!  Haven't really found anything negative about it other than difficulty getting a cover/stand for it.  Finally located the only cover made to fit which is sold exclusively on Amazon for just $14!  It is an excellent case and highly necessary to protect this tablet.  I don't understand why the only large tablets are Ipads, Samsungs, Acers, etc. at $400 plus, then the Coby for $150 or less, and they are all using the same OS and many similar parts.  Sure, the Ipad and Samsung probably operate considerably faster in some applications, but really, to play some games, take some pics, and surf the net I will gladly sacrifice a couple seconds per function by saving $300 + dollars!!!  Considering how easily these tablets can be broken I can't afford the risk.

Reviews.Title: Freedom is needed, urgently!
Reviews.Author: Bento Pereira
Reviews.Content: This is my first table. I'm used to Android OS, but never realized that Android OS can be more castrating than Windows!In a Windows OS you can go into C drive and delete whatever you want (even to destroy the OS itself). This Android is totally locked: you CANNOT install Market to have access to Google Play apps!?! (No Gmail, no Chat, etc) You ONLY can get apps from a "GetJar" app that is very poor and with few apps to choose from. You CAN'T even delete the pre-installed junk apps that come with it. These pre-installed apps are always running in the background consuming RAM and making this very slow tablet to be even more slow.Finally I was able to crack it down and now I have Market on it and managed to install some apps to kill the junky apps from running, but I'm not able to uninstall them. Freedom is needed to do whatever you want to do with your OS.The camera doesn't work already and the back cover is cracking although it never fall.
